page.title: 12Dormitary Town
page.content: Beaconsfield,a dormitory town,is in a very desirable residential area.It lies on the edge of the green belt with quick rail and road transport to London for commuters.The Old Town,a former coaching town has many fine Georgian and pre-Georgian houses -mainly terraced- and is now a conservation area.The new town grew after the railway came in 1906 when large Edwardian houses were set spacious gardens.Although most houses are owner-occupied,there are some council estates with semi-detached and terraced houses,some having been recently sold.Houses for private rent are rare;the purchase prices ranging form Â£40,000 to Â£500,000 make accomodation expensive.A four bedroomed detached house sells for Â£100,000 so that limits the choice for newcomers from cheaper housing areas.
